feed.title: NewsTracker: microsoft
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Microsoft Office now on multiple devices
entry.summary: Microsoft will sell Office for a one-time payment starting in September.

entry.title: Microsoft hands display ads to AOL, maps to Uber
entry.summary: The moves mean Microsoft will focus on its growing search advertising business based on its Bing search engine, and displaying maps on its Windows devices rather than generating the maps themselves.

entry.title: Review: Microsoft Office navigates a world of multiple devices
entry.summary: This product image provided by Microsoft shows Microsoft Word for Mac, part of the new Microsoft Office 2016 Mac suite.

entry.title: Microsoft Office now on multiple devices
entry.summary: The company released Microsoft Office 2016 for Mac on Thursday and new apps for Android phones two weeks ago.

entry.title: Review: Microsoft Office in a world of multiple devices
Review: Microsoft Office in a world of multiple devices
entry.summary:
NEW YORK (AP) - Microsoft's new Office apps do a good job of helping us navigate a world in which we frequently switch from one device to another - from a Mac to a Windows PC, with a smartphone or tablet along the way.

Those with an Office 365 subscription can get the Mac Office starting Thursday at http://office.microsoft.com.

entry.title: Microsoft sheds some of its ad business, mapping service
entry.summary:
AOL, meanwhile, is adopting Microsoft's Bing search engine, replacing Google as the default option for visitors who want to search the Internet on AOL websites.

That means Microsoft will get a share of revenue from advertising that's tied directly to Internet searches performed on AOL.

Microsoft and AOL declined to reveal details of how they will share revenue from the new pact.

entry.title: Microsoft cuts 7,800 jobs as phone sales flag
entry.summary: Analysts have said the Nokia business was a drag on Microsoft's profits.

entry.title: Microsoft cutting 7,800 jobs as phone sales flag
entry.summary:
Three years ago, Microsoft wrote off another big sum, $6.2 billion, on its purchase of digital advertising firm aQuantive.

Microsoft isn't getting out of the hardware business altogether.

entry.title: Microsoft to cut 7,800 jobs as phone sales sag
entry.summary: Microsoft will cut 7,800 jobs and take a US$7.6 billion impairment charge as it attempts to revive its flagging phone hardware business.

entry.title: Microsoft cutting up to 7,800 jobs
entry.summary: Microsoft closed its $7.2 billion deal for Nokia last year.

entry.title: Microsoft to cut up to 7,800 jobs
entry.summary: Microsoft announced plans Wednesday to restructure the company's phone hardware business and to cut up to 7,800 positions.

entry.title: Major Job Cuts Expected at Microsoft
entry.summary:
At the end of March, Microsoft had more than 118,000 employees globally.

Last month, the company said that Stephen Elop, the former chief executive of Nokia who became a senior Microsoft executive after the acquisition, overseeing its devices business, would leave Microsoft.

entry.title: Microsoft plans major job cuts: NYT
entry.summary:
Microsoft Corp, the world's largest software company, plans to announce a new round of layoffs as early as Wednesday as it tries to cut costs further, the New York Times reported.

The layoffs are expected to affect employees at the hardware group and other parts of the company, including the smartphone business that Microsoft acquired from Nokia last year, the newspaper said.

entry.title: Microsoft plans major job cuts: report
entry.summary: The latest job cuts are in addition to the 18,000 jobs Microsoft said it planned to cut a year ago, the newspaper said, citing sources familiar with the matter.

entry.title: Microsoft's Xbox Music Renamed Groove Music in Upcoming Windows 10
entry.summary: But it seems the new Microsoft Groove and Groove Music Pass have nothing to do with Zikera.

entry.title: Microsoft sheds some of its ad business, mapping service
entry.summary: Microsoft is handing off some its digital advertising business to AOL and selling its street-image mapping operation to Uber, as the giant software company tries to focus on activities more relevant to its core business.

entry.title: Microsoft sheds some of its ad business, mapping service
entry.summary: Both companies characterized the deal as a win-win because Microsoft will gain more search advertising while AOL, which has been beefing up its display business, will now add Microsoft's websites to a host of other online properties where AOL can place messages for advertising clients.

entry.title: Microsoft sheds some of its ad business, mapping service
entry.summary: Under its agreement with AOL, Microsoft is unloading a business that's declined in importance over recent years.

entry.title: Microsoft sheds some of its ad business, mapping service
entry.summary:
But Microsoft, which is based in Redmond, Washington, will let AOL take over the selling of other types of advertising on Microsoft websites and apps, including MSN, Skype and Xbox.

An AOL Inc. spokeswoman said the New York-based online media company will extend job offers to all 1,200 people who worked in Microsoft's advertising business.

entry.title: Microsoft is sending HoloLens to space to help NASA
entry.summary: This is not the first collaboration between NASA and Microsoft.

entry.title: In Tech: Microsoft Office comes to Android, Foursquare brings back mayors
entry.summary: There are still no comparable apps for phones and tablets running Microsoft's own Windows system, though that will change once Windows 10 gets released next month.

entry.title: Microsoft Office finally available for Android
entry.summary:
Well, you're in luck, because Microsoft Office apps for Android are now available, the company said in a blog post on Wednesday.

For full access, users need a Microsoft Office 365 subscription.
